story:
Once upon a time, in the heart of Iraq, there lived a little camel named Ali. Ali was a curious and adventurous camel who loved exploring the vast deserts and valleys of his homeland.

One warm evening, as the sun dipped below the horizon and painted the sky in shades of orange and pink, Ali decided to go on an evening stroll. As he wandered through the sandy dunes, he came across a majestic oasis, sparkling in the moonlight.

In the oasis, Ali met a wise old tortoise named Farah, who had lived there for many years. Farah told Ali wonderful stories of the desert and its secrets, of ancient civilizations and magical creatures that roamed the lands long ago.

As the night sky twinkled with stars, Ali and Farah sat by the shimmering waters of the oasis, sharing tales and laughter. Ali listened intently to Farah's stories, his eyes wide with wonder and excitement.

Finally, as the night grew late, Farah bid Ali goodnight and told him to remember the beauty and magic of the desert always. Ali nodded, grateful for the wise tortoise's guidance, and made his way back home under the blanket of stars.

Lying in his cozy bed of soft sand, Ali closed his eyes, his heart filled with the enchanting stories he had heard that night. Drifting off to sleep, he dreamed of endless adventures in the desert, guided by the wisdom of the old tortoise.

And so, in the peaceful embrace of the desert night, Ali the camel found solace and joy in the stories he had been told, ready to embark on new adventures the next day.

As the stars watched over him, Ali fell into a deep and restful sleep, his dreams filled with the magic of the desert and the wisdom of his dear friend, Farah the tortoise. And so, dear child, remember to always embrace the wonders of the world around you, for there is magic to be found in every corner of our beautiful land. Goodnight, sweet dreams.
